              [

          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              [
                "Note that unlike GCC, Visual Studio doesn’t provide a front-end for the linker ("
              ],
              ["link.exe", [["c"]]],
              [") via the compiler ("],
              ["cl.exe", [["c"]]],
              [
                "), but instead provides the linker as a separate program, which the compiler calls as it exits. "
              ],
              ["cl.exe", [["c"]]],
              [" and "],
              ["link.exe", [["c"]]],
              [" can be used separately with different files and options, or "],
              ["cl", [["c"]]],
              [" can be told to pass files and options to "],
              ["link", [["c"]]],
              [
                " if both tasks are done together. Any linking options specified to "
              ],
              ["cl", [["c"]]],
              [" will be translated into options for "],
              ["link", [["c"]]],
              [", and any files not processed by "],
              ["cl", [["c"]]],
              [" will be passed directly to "],
              ["link", [["c"]]],
              [
                ". As this is mainly a simple guide to compiling with the Visual Studio command line, arguments for "
              ],
              ["link", [["c"]]],
              [" will not be described at this time; if you need a list, see "],
              [
                "here",
                [
                  [
                    "a",
                    "https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/y0zzbyt4.aspx"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              ["."]
            ]
          },

            "language": [["Plain Text"]],
            "title": [
              [
                "cl /O1 main.cpp\n// Optimise for executable size.  Produces small programs, at the possible expense of slower\n//  execution.\n\ncl /O2 main.cpp\n// Optimise for execution speed.  Produces fast programs, at the possible expense of larger\n//  file size.\n\ncl /GL main.cpp other.cpp\n// Generates special object files used for whole-program optimisation, which allows CL to\n//  take every module (translation unit) into consideration during optimisation.\n// Passes the option \"/LTCG\" (Link-Time Code Generation) to LINK, telling it to call CL during\n//  the linking phase to perform additional optimisations.  If linking is not performed at this\n//  time, the generated object files should be linked with \"/LTCG\".\n// Can be used with other CL optimisation options."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "code",
          "version": 1
        }
      },

          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",

          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1550523812892,
          "id": "5cbd260d-ee99-4728-9ce5-93648c2349d8",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1550523812892,
          "parent_id": "836062be-ea49-41d4-b7c2-e23fe82a4f71",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["Both "],
              ["/o", [["c"]]],
              [" and "],
              ["/Fe", [["c"]]],
              [" pass their parameter (let’s call it "],
              ["o-param", [["c"]]],
              [") to "],
              ["link", [["c"]]],
              [" as "],
              ["/OUT:o-param", [["c"]]],
              [", appending the appropriate extension (generally "],
              [".exe", [["c"]]],
              [" or "],
              [".dll", [["c"]]],
              [") to “name” "],
              ["o-param", [["c"]]],
              ["s as necessary. While both "],
              ["/o", [["c"]]],
              [" and "],
              ["/Fe", [["c"]]],
              [
                " are to my knowledge identical in functionality, the latter is preferred for Visual Studio. "
              ],
              ["/o", [["c"]]],
              [
                " is marked as deprecated, and appears to mainly be provided for programmers more familiar with GCC or Clang."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1
        }
      },

          "parent_id": "836062be-ea49-41d4-b7c2-e23fe82a4f71",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["For anyone more familiar with *nix systems and/or GCC/Clang, "],
              ["cl", [["c"]]],
              [", "],
              ["link", [["c"]]],
              [
                ", and other Visual Studio command line tools can accept parameters specified with a hyphen (such as "
              ],
              ["-c", [["c"]]],
              [") instead of a slash (such as "],
              ["/c", [["c"]]],
              [
                "). Additionally, Windows recognises either a slash or a backslash as a valid path separator, so *nix-style paths can be used as well. This makes it easy to convert simple compiler command lines from "
              ],
              ["g++", [["c"]]],
              [" or "],
              ["clang++", [["c"]]],
              [" to "],
              ["cl", [["c"]]],
              [", or vice versa, with minimal changes."]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1
        }

      "c81e2a13-b2ea-4f8e-b712-cf8aa477a781": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1550523812891,
          "id": "c81e2a13-b2ea-4f8e-b712-cf8aa477a781",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1550523812891,
          "parent_id": "836062be-ea49-41d4-b7c2-e23fe82a4f71",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "language": [["Plain Text"]],
            "title": [
              [
                "cl /o name main.cpp\n// Generates executable named \"name.exe\".\n\ncl /o folder\\ main.cpp\n// Generates executable named \"main.exe\", in folder \"%cd%\\folder\".\n\ncl /o folder\\name main.cpp\n// Generates executable named \"name.exe\", in folder \"%cd%\\folder\".\n\ncl /Fename main.cpp\n// Same as \"/o name\".\n\ncl /Fefolder\\ main.cpp\n// Same as \"/o folder\\\".\n\ncl /Fefolder\\name main.cpp\n// Same as \"/o folder\\name\"."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "code",
          "version": 5
        }
      },
      "c82e58e8-2386-4a87-a86d-d03dd607a876": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1550523812895,
          "id": "c82e58e8-2386-4a87-a86d-d03dd607a876",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1550523812895,
          "parent_id": "836062be-ea49-41d4-b7c2-e23fe82a4f71",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "language": [["Plain Text"]],
            "title": [
              [
                "cl /EHsc main.cpp\n// \"/EHsc\" specifies that only standard C++ (\"synchronous\") exceptions will be caught,\n//  and `extern \"C\"` functions will not throw exceptions.\n// This is recommended when writing portable, platform-independent code.\n\ncl /clr main.cpp\n// \"/clr\" specifies that the code should be compiled to use the common language runtime,\n//  the .NET Framework's virtual machine.\n// Enables the use of Microsoft's C++/CLI language in addition to standard (\"native\") C++,\n//  and creates an executable that requires .NET to run.\n\ncl /Za main.cpp\n// \"/Za\" specifies that Microsoft extensions should be disabled, and code should be\n//  compiled strictly according to ISO C++ specifications.\n// This is recommended for guaranteeing portability.\n\ncl /Zi main.cpp\n// \"/Zi\" generates a program database (PDB) file for use when debugging a program, without\n//  affecting optimisation specifications, and passes the option \"/DEBUG\" to LINK.\n\ncl /LD dll.cpp\n// \"/LD\" tells CL to configure LINK to generate a DLL instead of an executable.\n// LINK will output a DLL, in addition to an LIB and EXP file for use when linking.\n// To use the DLL in other programs, pass its associated LIB to CL or LINK when compiling those\n//  programs.\n\ncl main.cpp /link /LINKER_OPTION\n// \"/link\" passes everything following it directly to LINK, without parsing it in any way.\n// Replace \"/LINKER_OPTION\" with any desired LINK option(s)."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "code",
          "version": 5
        }
      },
      "d46145a4-c53c-46cd-8d17-c9c4c5a6a9cd": {

            "title": [
              ["Note that while the space between "],
              ["/o", [["c"]]],
              [" and the specified folder and/or name is optional, there "],
              ["cannot", [["i"]]],
              [" be a space between "],
              ["/Fe", [["c"]]],
              [" and the specified folder and/or name."]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",

          "version": 1

          "properties": {
            "language": [["Plain Text"]],
            "title": [
              [
                "cl main.cpp\n// Generates object file \"main.obj\".\n// Performs linking with \"main.obj\".\n// Generates executable \"main.exe\".\n\ncl /Od main.cpp\n// Same as above.\n// \"/Od\" is the \"Optimisation: disabled\" option, and is the default when no /O is specified."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "code",
          "version": 1
        }
      },

          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",

          "properties": {
            "language": [["Plain Text"]],
            "title": [
              [
                "cl main.cpp src\\*.cpp\n// Generates object file \"main.obj\", plus one object file for each \".cpp\" file in folder\n//  \"%cd%\\src\".\n// Performs linking with \"main.obj\", and every additional object file generated.\n// All object files will be in the current folder.\n// Generates executable \"main.exe\"."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "code",
          "version": 1
